title: Egg Creams
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 180°C

Heat up the milk and vanilla sugar together

Meanwhile, whisk the white sugar into the eggs until white (approximately 5 min)

When the milk is hot, pour into the egg mixture and mix well 

Pour the mixture into 6-8 ramekins (with liquid caramel at the bottom if desired)

Cook for 30 min in a bain-marie

title: Galette des rois
instructions:
Cream the butter, then add 100g of sugar and the almonds

Mix in one egg and the rum

Heat up the milk, add 30g of sugar and the cornstarch and stirs until it thickens

Wait until it cools down then add into the almond mixture.

Do an egg wash on the rim of the first puff party to create a seal

Spread the filling onto a puff pastry, cover with another one and seal shut with a fork

Draw on the top puff pastry with the point of a knife and paint with an egg wash

Let it rest an hour minimum in the fridge while the oven preheats at 240°C

Bake at 240°C for 10 minutes and at 180°C for 20 extra minutes

title: Mediterranean semolina salad
instructions:
In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, mustard, honey, lemon juice and red pepper flakes, with some salt and pepper.

Dice the tomatoes and the cucumber, add the drained chickpeas and the sliced onion. Pour into the marinade and let rest.

Bring the stock to a boil, stir in the couscous and cover with a lid. Reduced heat to low and cook for 8-10 minutes, until all liquid has evaporated.

Add cooked couscous to the marinating tomatoes, cucumbers, chickpeas, and onions

Add drained olives and spinach. Stir to combine

Top the salad with crumbled feta

title: Flour porridge
instructions:
Heat up a skillet on medium heat, then add the flour in an even layer.

Let the flour sit untouched for about a minute, then stir and let sit for 30 seconds, before stirring again.

Repeat the process until the flour is evenly browned, for about 15 minutes.

Remove from the heat, set aside and allow the flour to cool completely.

Add 4 cups of water to a pot on high heat, then the cinnamon sticks, the cloves, and cardamom pods. 

Cover and let boil for about 10 minutes, then filter the spices out of the water.

Sieve the toasted flour into a mixing bowl, then add 2 cups of water and whisk until combined into a smooth pancake batter consistency.

Pour the batter into the pot of spiced water and whisk to combine. Cook on medium heat for 5 minutes, whisking often.

Add the evaporated milk, condensed milk, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon and nutmeg. Whisk to combine, then serve hot.

title: Baguettes
instructions:
Mix all the ingredients and knead for 15-20 minutes.

Proof for 2 hours.

Form 4 baguettes, cut them with the knife point, then sprinkle flour on top.

Cover and let rise while the oven is preheating to 240°C.

Add water to the inside of the oven, then cook for 18 to 20 minutes, until golden.

title: Zucchini rice
instructions:
Add oil to a pot or pan and add uncooked rice.

Let simmer on medium heat while mixing until the rice becomes translucent.

Add curry, salt, pepper, and other spices of your choosing.

Add diced up zucchini and water (same volume as the rice).

Keep on medium heat until the rice is fully cooked, adding water if necessary.

Finish by adding coconut milk until creamy and delicious.

title: Pâte à crêpes
instructions:
Melt the butter in a saucepan or microwave.

Add the dry ingredients, then the eggs, milk, and rum.

Let it rest for 45 min to an hour, then cook the crêpes.

title: Ratatouille
instructions:
Peel the tomatoes and dice all the vegetables

Sauté the shallots, then add the zucchini and eggplant

Let simmer before adding tomatoes and bell peppers, as well as garlic, salt, and pepper

Cook slowly for about an hour, then adjust the seasoning

title: Moroccan Tea Biscuits
instructions:
Stir together sugar, butter, almonds, orange-flower water, anise seeds, extracts, and 1/4 cup sesame seeds in a large bowl. 

Add eggs and stir until well combined. Stir in flour, baking powder, and salt until just combined. 

Chill dough, covered, for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350°F (176°C) with rack in middle.

Using moistened hands, halve dough and form 2 (11- by 3-inch) loaves on an ungreased baking sheet. 

Brush with enough egg wash to coat, then sprinkle with remaining tablespoon sesame seeds.

Bake until pale golden, about 30 minutes. 

Loosen from baking sheet with a spatula, then transfer loaves to a rack and cool 15 minutes. (Leave oven on.)

Cut warm loaves into 3/4-inch slices with a serrated knife and arrange biscuits, with a cut side down, on a clean baking sheet. 

Bake until golden, 20 to 25 minutes. Transfer to rack to cool completely.

title: Beignets
instructions:
Bloom the yeast by combining it with the warm milk, and adding 1 tbsp of sugar

Rest for 10 min, then add the egg, the rest of the sugar, salt, and 2/3 of the flour

Mix for 10-20 min

Add the room temp butter along with the rest of the flour

Mix until fully combined and elastic

Cover with plastic wrap and let proof for 2 hours

Roll out on a floured surface and cut it into equal squares (makes about 20 beignets)

Fry them in hot oil and switch sides when brown

Drizzle with honey and icing sugar, and serve

title: Couscous
instructions:
Cut the tomatoes, carrots and turnips into chunks.

Add the chicken pieces into the hot pot with olive oil, and sear each side until golden.

Add a liter of water, the beef broth, the tomatoes, carrots, and turnips.
 
Add the diced tomatoes with the various spices and harissa.

Close the pressure cooker and count 30 minutes after the pressure builds.

Meanwhile, drain the chickpeas and cut the zucchinis into chunks the same size as the other veggies.

When the 30 minutes are over, depressurize the pressure cooker, and add the zucchini and chickpeas.

Adjust the seasoning as needed, then close the lid and count 10 minutes from the pressure building.

Serve with semolina and merguez cooked on the side.

title: KKwabaegi
instructions:
Mix 3 tbsp of sugar with the cinnamon and set aside.

Melt the butter in a pan, then remove from the heat and add milk, the 2 tbsp of leftover sugar, and salt.

Mix until everything is well dissolved, then add the egg.

Let it rest for 5 minutes.

Add the flour and mix well with a wooden spoon, then knead for a few minutes with your hands.

Be careful not to overmix it, don't develop too much gluten. 

Shape into a ball, cover with plastic wrap and let it rise for 1 to 1 and a half hour.

Deflate the dough and knead until smooth.

Cover and let it rise again, for 30 minutes to an hour.

Uncover the dough, knead a little bit and divide the dough into 16 equal pieces.

Shape the kkwabaegi by twisting the dough ropes, then let it expand for 30 minutes while the oil is heating up.

Deep fry the donuts until brown on all sides, then cover with the cinnamon sugar.

title: Blueberry Pancakes
instructions:
Mix the milk and vinegar and let sit for a few minutes.

Whisk the dry ingredients together, then add the egg, milk, and melted butter.

Pour into a buttered pan and scatter blueberries on top.

Flip and cook both sides.

title: Potée au chou
instructions:
Cut the cabbage into strips, then blanch them by steaming them for 15 minutes.

Meanwhile, peel and cut the potatoes and carrots into chunks.

Chop the onion and sauté it with the lardons into a pot.

Add 800g of water and the vegetable broth, and season with herbes de provence.

Add the carrots and potatoes to the pot, and the sausages to the cabbage in the steaming basket.

Cook for an hour, and serve everything mixed.

title: Red Lentils Dhal
instructions:
Cook the lentils in a pot after rinsing them (10 min covered in water)

Slice the carrots thinly (after peeling them)

Sauté the garlic in hot oil for about a minute, then add the tomatoes, carrots, tomato concentrate and spices

Add the coconut milk and let simmer for 10 minutes

Add the lentils, mix well and serve with rice or bread

title: Mssemen
instructions:
Put the water, yeast, sugar, salt, and semolina in a bowl and mix them till everything melts together
 
Add flour to the mixture and knead it well

Let it rest for half an hour

Cut the dough into medium-sized balls 

In a small bowl add the oil and baking powder and mix them well

Spread the dough-balls on a surface that has the oil and baking powder mixture till it's decently thin

Spread more of the oil and baking powder mixture on the face of the dough and dust it with some semolina

Fold and repeat the previous step till the dough is square-shaped

Heat up the pan on medium heat with oil and then cook the mssemen pieces you have on the pan till it gets a nice golden color, flip and do the same on the other side

Plate and dust them with fine sugar

title: Peas Pasta
instructions:
Slice the onion and sauté in oil

Add the drained peas to the pan and cook for around 10 minutes

Meanwhile, boil water and cook the pasta

Add the coconut milk, let reduce and thicken before adding the tomato paste

Add the drained pasta to the sauce before serving

title: Oven roasted tomatoes
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 200°C

Cut the tomatoes into slices, and put them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper

Douse with olive oil, then sprinkle salt, pepper, garlic, and other herbs and spices

Cook for 20-30 minutes in the oven until golden and soft

title: Rice Salad
instructions:
Cook the rice and the hard boiled eggs and let them cool in the fridge

Dice all the vegetables and add them to the rice and eggs

Mash the tuna and add it to the rest of the ingredients

Make a mustard centered vinaigrette with red wine vinegar and add it to the salad right before serving

title: Beef Tartare
instructions:
Mix all the sauce ingredients together except the olive oil and parsley

Add the olive oil while whisking

Add the meat to the sauce as well as the parsley

Store in the fridge for no more than 2 hours before serving

Add more of everything (except eggs, less) and TASTE
faire des cuilleres genereuses
